sentence: The department published a short summary of the survey. It said there were 40 respondents in total. It also stated that 22 responded online and 20 responded in person. The same summary claimed the survey ended on March 5 and began on March 10. No other details were unusual.
explanation: The sentence contains two errors: arithmetic inconsistency (280+250=530 instead of 500) and temporal inconsistency (store could either be inside or across from the mall).

sentence: The event guide explains where to find the workshop room. It says the room is inside City Mall on the second floor. It also says the same room is across the street from City Mall next to the bus stop. The guide lists the room’s height as 30 liters. Everything else looks like a normal 안내문.
explanation: The room description mentions it's inside City Mall on the second floor and across the street from the bus stop, which contradicts the information provided in the event guide.

sentence: The biography describes Hana’s education and work history. It says she completed her undergraduate degree in 2021. It also says she joined the company as a full-time analyst in 2023. The bio adds that after graduation, she started her first job at the same company. The rest of the paragraph is consistent.
explanation: The sentence contains two errors: the total number of years Hana completed her undergraduate degree is incorrect (2021 instead of 2021), and the year she joined the company is incorrect (2023 instead of 2023).

sentence: The building notice describes the parking facility. It says the lot has 60 spaces in total. It also says 35 spaces are covered and 30 spaces are uncovered. The notice states the parking lot is under the building, but also on the rooftop of the building. All other information seems ordinary.

Olivia led the meeting and presented the weekly plan. Everyone asked questions and Olivia answered them clearly. After the meeting, he sent the summary email to the team. The minutes also stated that the projector apologized for the delay. The rest of the notes look normal.
explanation: There are two errors: 1. The number of items in section A doesn't add up correctly (280 + 250 = 530 instead of 500). 2. The location of the manager's office is incorrect (the manager is described as being inside the mall, which is wrong).

sentence: The lab note describes a quick protocol change. It says the sample should be incubated at 5 meters. It also states that the centrifuge decided to stop early. The note continues with routine cleanup instructions. Nothing else is contradictory.
explanation: The sentence contains two errors: the number of samples should be 5 instead of 10, and the time frame should be specified.

sentence: The team circulated a short report about this month’s registrations. It said there were 95 registrations in total. It also said 55 were for the morning session and 40 were for the afternoon session. The report stated that each person chose exactly one session. It then claimed the registration period opened on June 1 and closed on June 10. The rest of the email was ordinary.
explanation: There are two errors in the sentence.

sentence: The brochure describes a small exhibition space for visitors. It says the gallery is inside the museum, past the main lobby on the first floor. A later sentence says the same gallery is outside the museum building across the street. The brochure lists the ceiling height as 12 kilograms. It also mentions that photography is allowed without flash. It ends with the ticket counter hours and a contact number.
explanation: The statement about the gallery being outside the museum building across the street is incorrect.

sentence: The profile introduces Joon as a new hire and summarizes his background. It says he started his first full-time job in 2020. It also says he finished university in 2022. The profile frames the job as his first role after graduation. In the next sentence, it says that after graduation, she moved to the company’s headquarters. The rest of the page contains no other dates or names.
pred_correction: The profile introduces Joon as a new hire and summarizes his background. It says he started his first full-time job in 2020. It also says he finished university in 2022. The profile frames the job as his first role after graduation. In the next sentence, it says that after graduation, she moved to the company's headquarters. The rest of the page contains no other dates or names.
explanation: The sentence contains two errors: arithmetic inconsistency (280+250=530 instead of 500) and temporal inconsistency (2020 and 2022). The corrected sentence is: 'The profile introduces Joon as a new hire and summarizes his background. It says he started his first full-time job in 2020. It also says he finished university in 2022. The profile frames the job as his first role after graduation. In the next sentence, it says that after graduation, she moved to the company's headquarters. The rest of the page contains no other dates or names.'

sentence: The campus notice provides directions to the counseling center. It says the office is on the third floor of the main building near the east stairs. Another line says the same office is in the basement of the main building next to the storage room. The notice also states there are 25 appointment slots per day. It then says 15 slots are for walk-ins and 15 slots are for scheduled visits. The rest of the notice explains how to contact staff.
explanation: The notice mentions two offices: one on the third floor of the main building and another in the basement. These locations do not correspond.

sentence: The meeting recap describes how Mina organized the rollout plan. Mina introduced the schedule and assigned tasks to each teammate. Several people thanked Mina for clarifying priorities. After the meeting, she uploaded the finalized document to the shared drive. The recap also stated that the coordinator promised to handle follow-up questions from stakeholders. The rest of the recap contains normal action items and deadlines.
explanation: There are two errors in the sentence.

sentence: The operations log summarizes a minor incident during shipping. It says workers sorted parcels and updated the tracking dashboard. It then states that the barcode called the supervisor to request more staff. The log also records that the conveyor speed was set to 4 liters. It continues by noting that the delay was resolved and deliveries returned to normal. Aside from those statements, the log reads like a standard report.
